roleset.name: to (cause) to make a sound of a bell, ring a bell, emitting a high clear noise (like a bell)

example.name: passive
example.text: According to a nationwide survey taken [*] a year ago , [nearly a third of England 's church bells]-1 are no longer rung [*-1] on Sundays because there is no one [0] [*T*-2] to ring them .
example.arg: , [nearly a third of England 's church bells]-1

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: `` [*-1] To ring for even one service at this tower , we-1 have [*-1]to scrape , '' says [*T*-2] Mr. Hammond , a retired water-authority worker .

example.name: intransitive with Arg0
example.text: One survey says that of the 100,000 trained bellringers in England today , only 40,000 of them still ring .
example.arg: of the 100,000 trained bellringers in England today

example.name: intransitive with Arg1
example.text: There were too many phones ringing and too many things happening [*] to expect market makers to be as efficient as robots .

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: He said the house was illuminated, but that he received no answer to his ring of the bell

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: At the ring of the bell for Camp's night activity of junior kickball, we said our goodbyes...
example.arg: for Camp's night activity of junior kickball,

example.name: argMs
example.text: My wife has Constant ringing in her ears ::: noise , a " whooshing " as she describes .

example.name: all args
example.text: They manifested themselves on one occasion in his ringing the bell for a messenger to forcibly eject his colleague, Mr. Ballance, from tho Cabinet room.
example.arg: for a messenger to forcibly eject his colleague, Mr. Ballance, from tho Cabinet room.

roleset.note: RING-V NOTES: Frames file for 'ring' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from ring.01-v predicate notes)
RING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on ring-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls sound_emission-43.2. (from ring.01-n)
RINGING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, ring-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls sound_emission-43.2. (from ringing.01-n)

roleset.name: to surround

example.name: both arguments
example.text: Meanwhile , in the squat office buildings that [*T*] ring Fashion Island , the odds [*ICH*-3]are good that someone is getting fleeced [*-2] .

roleset.note: RING-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls fill-9.8, contiguous_location-47.8. (from ring.02-v)

example.name: London calling...
example.text: With sudden energy , she went to the phone and rang Holden 's office and asked for him .

roleset.name: ring true (or ring of some other attribute), sounds like

example.name: ring true
example.text: Medical doctor Chang Chau-hsiung, [whose advice]-9 [*T*]-9 rings [*]-9 true to his profession, has formally taken off his physician 's coat * to vie for office as James Soong 'sr unning mate.

example.name: other attribute
example.text: I may not be fully understanding the point here , but to me this kind of rings of greed itself .

example.name: both args
example.text: For some terrorism experts today 's attack , which occurred against the backdrop of intense clashes between Palestinians and Israelis in the Middle East , has an eerily familiar ring to it .

example.name: both args, different syntax
example.text: your vision of the near future makes me shudder because of its ring of truth.

roleset.note: RING-V NOTES: Frame added by Arrick (from ring.05-v)
RING-N NOTES: Added by Julia corresponding to ring-v.05, although this frame is open to other arg2s than just 'true'. No corresponding VNcls. (from ring.02-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Younkers rang up sales [*ICH*] in 1988 [of $ 313 million *U*] .
